"32 bit float" 1 1 Last First

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The LIDAR Composite First Return Digital Surface Model (DSM) is a raster elevation model at 1m spatial resolution produced by the Environment Agency in 2022. The First Return Digital Surface Model (DSM) is derived from LIDAR data captured as part of our national timeseries programme between 11th November 2016 and 5th May 2022. This programme divided England into local blocks for survey over continuous winters from 2016 onwards. These individual surveys have then been merged together to create the LIDAR Composite using a feathering technique along the overlaps to remove any small differences in elevation between surveys. Where repeat surveys have been undertaken the newest, best resolution data is used. Where data was resampled a bilinear interpolation was used before being merging.
The elevations are presented in metres referenced to Ordinance Survey Newlyn using the OSTN 15 and OSGM 15 transformation models. The LIDAR elevations have a vertical accuracy of +/-15cm RMSE.
The first return DSM will not match in coverage or extent the standard DSM composite which is produced from the last or only return as the last return DSM composite is produced from both the national LIDAR programme and Timeseries surveys.
Please refer to the supplied survey index shapefile which shows for any location, which LIDAR surveys went into the production of the LIDAR composite for a specific location. The survey index shapefile contains informaiton including the exact date of survey and source resolution of data.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This raster forms part of the LIDAR Composite 2022 1m First Return Digital Surface Model (DSM) produced by the Environment Agency.
